Class Scene

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Panel
          • java.applet.Applet
            • processing.core.PApplet
              • framework.Scene
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.FocusListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseWheelListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, processing.core.PConstants
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MyScene

    public class Scene
extends processing.core.PApplet
    Default setup for G53GRA Coursework. You should subclass Scene and add your functionality. Override initialise() to add DisplayableObjects to your Scene. Running your subclass will setup and draw objects based on your initialise() function.

    Functions that can be overloaded:
    initialise()
    setInitWindowSize()
    projection()
    reshape()
    globalLighting()
    update() (advanced)
    setupGL() (advanced)

    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    wil
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • camera

        protected Camera camera
        Scene camera. Contains viewing properties. Defaults to framework Camera class. Overload initialise() to set a different Camera. Remember to access as super.camera.

        public Scene()

    • Method Detail

      • setup

        public final void setup()
        Default setup method to initialise Scene

        Finds declaration of window size in (overloaded) setInitWindowSize() method and opens a 3D rendering PApplet. Overload initialise() to add calls during setup.

        It is strongly recommended you do NOT attempt to override this method.

        Overrides:
        setup in class processing.core.PApplet
        See Also:
        draw(), initialise(), setInitWindowSize()

      • initialise

        protected void initialise()
        Default properties of Scene(). Overload this to add DisplayableObjects to your scene. Call super() in your overloaded function to setup default Camera and projection property.
        See Also:
        setup(), Camera, projection()

      • setInitWindowSize

        protected void setInitWindowSize()
        Default window size for Scene(). Overload this method and call set super.initWidth and super.initHeight to your preferred window width and height respectively.
        See Also:
        setup()

      • setupGL

        protected void setupGL()
        Sets rendering properties of your scene by accessing OpenGL commands directly.

        You should only overload this method if you are confident in your understanding of the PGL binding.

        See Also:
        setup(), draw()

      • draw

        public final void draw()
        Called directly after setup() ends. This function will loop continuously until the program is exited. The draw loop can be paused by calling PApplet.noLoop() and called manually with PApplet.redraw(). Calling PApplet.loop() will allow draw() to run continuously again.

        The frequency at which draw() is called per second can be controlled by calling PApplet.frameRate(float)

        It is strongly recommended you do NOT attempt to override this method.

        draw() should NEVER be called explicitly.

        Overrides:
        draw in class processing.core.PApplet
        See Also:
        setup(), reshape(), PApplet.redraw(), PApplet.frameRate(float), PApplet.loop(), PApplet.noLoop()

      • setBackgroundColour

        protected final void setBackgroundColour()
        Sets the clear (background) colour of the rendering window. By default, the colour is black, but can be called with either an int grey value [0-255], or (R,G,B) values as an either float [0.f-1.f] or int [0-255]. Optionally, the alpha value can be specified as an additional parameter to control transparency. This should be of the same type as the colour values specified, i.e. float or int.
        See Also:
        setBackgroundColour(int g), setBackgroundColour(float r, float g, float b), setBackgroundColour(int r, int g, int b), setBackgroundColour(float r, float g, float b, float a), setBackgroundColour(int r, int g, int b, int a)

      • setBackgroundColour

        protected final void setBackgroundColour(int g)
        Parameters:
        g - grey-scale value [0-255]
        See Also:
        setBackgroundColour()

      • setBackgroundColour

                                         float g,
                                         float b)
        Parameters:

        g - green colour value [0.f-1.f]
        b - blue colour value [0.f-1.f]
        See Also:

        g - green colour value [0.f-1.f]
        b - blue colour value [0.f-1.f]
        a - alpha value (transparency) [0.f-1.f]
        See Also:

      • reshape

        protected void reshape()
        Called during every draw() cycle. Intended to handle resizing events.

        You should this function to handle the window being resized. The default property is to update the projection parameters. You can axis the window size parameters by accessing the width and height variables. For example, you could overload this function to adjust the size of all objects in your Scene.

        See Also:
        draw(), projection(), initialise()

      • addObjectToScene

        protected final void addObjectToScene(DisplayableObject obj)
        Adds a DisplayableObject (includes AnimatedObjects) to the Scene. Generates automatic key for objects map based on number in scene. Automatically generated keys are of the form:

        "obj_[i-1]" for the ith DisplayableObject added to the Scene (counts AnimatedObjects).

        "ani_[i-1]" for the ith AnimatedObject added to the Scene.

        It is strongly recommended you do NOT attempt to override this method.

        Parameters:
        obj - DisplayableObject to be added to the scene.
        See Also:
        addObjectToScene(DisplayableObject, String), getObject(String)

      • addObjectToScene

        protected final void addObjectToScene(DisplayableObject obj,
                                      java.lang.String id)
        Adds a DisplayableObject (includes AnimatedObjects) to the Scene. String provided is key for objects map.

        It is strongly recommended you do NOT attempt to override this method.

        Parameters:
        obj - DisplayableObject to be added to the scene
        id - String value for accessing the objects map
        See Also:
        addObjectToScene(DisplayableObject), getObject(String)

      • getObject

        protected final DisplayableObject getObject(java.lang.String id)
        Access the map of DisplayableObjects.

        It is strongly recommended you do NOT attempt to override this method.

        Parameters:
        id - identifier of object
        Returns:
        The DisplayableObject value contained at key id

      • projection

        protected void projection()
        Sets the projection properties of the scene. Override to change projection properties.

        Default: Orthographic mode

      • update

        protected void update()
        The update function for Camera and AnimatedObjects. Calculates the time-delay since the last update and passes as a parameter to the respective class's update() functions.

        You should only override this class if you want to change how the animation update function works. This is not advised.

        See Also:
        Camera, AnimatedObject, draw(), runtime()

      • runtime

        protected final float runtime()
        Calculates time delay between updates and returns difference in seconds.

        It is strongly recommended you do NOT attempt to override this method.

        Returns:
        dT (T) the difference in time since the last call to runtime

      • lights

        public final void lights()
        Sets default lighting properties and applies all lighting to the scene.

        Enables lighting in all objects that implement Lighting, after globalLighting() is called.

        Overrides:
        lights in class processing.core.PApplet
        See Also:
        PApplet.noLights(), Lighting.setupLighting(), globalLighting(), resetLightProperties()

      • globalLighting

        protected void globalLighting()
        Default globalLighting. Sets up ambient lighting for the whole scene. Override to change global lighting.
        See Also:
        lights()

      • resetLightProperties

        protected final void resetLightProperties()
        Resets default lighting properties. These properties only affect lighting commands that come after they are called.

        Sets default specular colour to white [255,255,255].
        Sets default light attenuation to constant (non-decaying).

        See Also:
        globalLighting(), lights()

      • keyPressed

        public final void keyPressed()
        Called when a key is pressed. Indicates whether key pressed is ASCII or coded, and relays key information and mouse coordinates to Camera and any DisplayableObjects that implement Input.

        It is strongly recommended you do NOT attempt to override this method.

        Overrides:
        keyPressed in class processing.core.PApplet

      • keyReleased

        public final void keyReleased()
        Called when a key is released. Indicates whether key released is ASCII or coded, and relays key information and mouse coordinates to Camera and any DisplayableObjects that implement Input.

        It is strongly recommended you do NOT attempt to override this method.

        Overrides:
        keyReleased in class processing.core.PApplet

      • mouseDragged

        public final void mouseDragged()
        Called when mouse is moved while a button pressed. Relays coordinates to Camera and any DisplayableObjects that implement Input.

        It is strongly recommended you do NOT attempt to override this method.

        Overrides:
        mouseDragged in class processing.core.PApplet

      • mouseMoved

        public final void mouseMoved()
        Called when mouse is moved while no button pressed. Relays coordinates to Camera and any DisplayableObjects that implement Input.

        It is strongly recommended you do NOT attempt to override this method.

        Overrides:
        mouseMoved in class processing.core.PApplet

      • mousePressed

        public final void mousePressed()
        Called when a mouse button is pressed. Relays the button pressed (LEFT, RIGHT or CENTER), and the coordinates to Camera and any DisplayableObjects that implement Input.

        It is strongly recommended you do NOT attempt to override this method.

        Overrides:
        mousePressed in class processing.core.PApplet

      • mouseReleased

        public final void mouseReleased()
        Called when a mouse button is released. Relays the button released (LEFT, RIGHT or CENTER), and the coordinates to Camera and any DisplayableObjects that implement Input.

        It is strongly recommended you do NOT attempt to override this method.

        Overrides:
        mouseReleased in class processing.core.PApplet
